law.catch_line: Recognition of adverse claim to a deposit.
law.text:
Notice to any bank doing business in the Commonwealth of any adverse claim to a deposit standing on its books to the credit of any person shall not be effective to cause the bank to recognize the adverse claim unless the adverse claimant shall also either:
Procure a restraining order, injunction, or other appropriate process against the bank from a court of competent jurisdiction, where the person to whose credit the deposit stands is made a party to the action and served with summons; or
Execute to such bank, in form and with sureties acceptable to it, a bond indemnifying the bank from any and all liability, loss, damage, costs, and expenses, for and on account of the payment of the adverse claim or the dishonor of any check or other order of the person to whose credit the deposit stands on the books of the bank.
law.history: Created 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 362, sec. 1, effective June 17, 1978.

metadata.lrc-note: (7/12/2006). In accordance with 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 247, secs. 38 and 39, this statute has been renumbered as a section of the Kentucky Financial Services Code, KRS Chapter 286.
